data.title: Lower School K
data.meta_description: Lower School K-3 Teacher - Nardin Academy
data.text:
Summary Description:

Nardin Academy asks all in our community to “Inspire hearts and minds to do amazing things for the world through faith, character, academic excellence, and service.” A Nardin Academy teacher is dedicated to the mission of the Academy, committed to the study of pedagogy, motivated to work collaboratively, and committed to self-reflective practice and professional development.

The Lower (Elementary) School is seeking a patient and compassionate (K-3) Teacher who has an excellent understanding of how to meet students at their readiness level. This individual will organize and implement an appropriate instructional program in a nurturing learning environment that guides and encourages students to grow and develop academically as well as socially and emotionally. A Nardin Academy teacher is dedicated to the mission of the Academy, committed to the study of pedagogy, motivated to work collaboratively, and committed to self-reflective practice and professional development. This teacher is kind, self-motivated, self-directed, and able to manage time effectively while fulfilling curricular expectations.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Plans for the developmental needs of the children on an individual and group level in the areas of academic, emotional, social and psychomotor growth

Establishes and maintains cooperative and effective working relationships with colleagues

Maintains regular, open communication with parents, faculty, and administration

Communicates effectively orally and in writing

Demonstrates strong content knowledge as well as the ability to employ various instructional practices

Demonstrates a knowledge of assessments and the ability to use data for planning and instruction

Executes curriculum in an appropriate manner, including the use of technology to enhance student learning where developmentally appropriate

Demonstrate a working knowledge of Google Suite

Performs all other related work delegated or required to accomplish the objectives of the total school program

Duties and Responsibilities:

Supports and acts in accordance with the Academy’s mission

Prepares a welcoming and nurturing learning environment to facilitate the needs of all children

Strong literacy instructional skills

Understanding of the importance of phonics based instruction

Implements CPA (concrete-pictorial-abstract) methodology to mathematics instruction

Demonstrates excellent planning and preparation for instruction

Develops and implements individual and group lessons

Monitors student progress

Maintains and updates thorough academic records

Excellent organizational and observational skills

Must be a patient and nurturing individual

Develops and implements weekly, monthly, and annual curricular goals

Maintains professional credentials as appropriate

Other Duties:

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Elementary Education from an accredited institution

NY State or comparable certification in teaching

Prior teaching experience of students in grades K-3

Orton-Gillingham training/certification a plus but not required

Working Conditions:

The work environment is a standard classroom setting. The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate, but occasionally high depending upon student population and activities. The employee is occasionally exposed to wet or humid conditions and/or outdoor weather conditions. The employee may be exposed to bloodborne pathogens.

Physical Requirements:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to walk, stand, sit, use hands for fine manipulation, handle or feel and reach with hands and arms using a keyboard and video display terminal. The employee is occasionally required to stoop, kneel or crouch. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, ability to adjust focus and peripheral vision.

Salary:

Commensurate with experience

To apply, please submit the following materials as a .pdf or.docx to hr@nardin.org. Please include:

Cover letter expressing your interest and qualifications

Current resume with appropriate dates

Minimum of 3 references with names, telephone numbers and email addresses
